text: Datuk Abdul Aziz bin Sattar (8 August 1925 – 6 May 2014) was a Malaysian actor, singer, comedian, and director known for his roles in 1950s and 1960s Malay black-and-white films. In 1952, Aziz and his friends were invited to work at Malay Film Productions. He started as a crew member, then joined the supporting cast of Putus Harapan in 1953. He became a popular comedian, often appearing with P. Ramlee, especially in the Bujang Lapok series. He died of heart disease on 6 May 2014 at about 2:00 am (MYT) in KPJ Kajang Specialist Hospital.
